properties.desc:
• National Hurricane Center shifts possible track of Katrina to the Mississippi/Louisiana coast
  • Governor Blanco declares state of emergency for Louisiana
  • Results in 922 Army National Guard and 8 Air National Guard deployed to Louisiana

• National Hurricane Center shifts possible track of Katrina to the Mississippi/Louisiana coast
  • Governor Blanco declares state of emergency for Louisiana
  • Results in 922 Army National Guard and 8 Air National Guard deployed to Louisiana

• National Hurricane Center shifts possible track of Katrina to the Mississippi/Louisiana coast
  • Governor Blanco declares state of emergency for Louisiana
  • Results in 922 Army National Guard and 8 Air National Guard deployed to Louisiana

• St. Charles Parish, St. Tammany Parish, and Plaquemines Parish under mandatory evacuation
  • Mandatory evacuation of coastal areas of Grand Isle, Crown Point, Lafitte, and Barataria
  • Tolls suspended on Lake Pontchartrain Causeway and Crescent City Connection

• St. Charles Parish, St. Tammany Parish, and Plaquemines Parish under mandatory evacuation
  • Mandatory evacuation of coastal areas of Grand Isle, Crown Point, Lafitte, and Barataria
  • Tolls suspended on Lake Pontchartrain Causeway and Crescent City Connection

• New Orleans Mayor announces state of emergency and calls for volunteer evacuation (no mandatory evacuation until 30 hours before expected landfall)
  • President Bush declares federal state of emergency in Louisiana upon request
  • 1701 Army National Guard and 932 Air National Guard deployed

• New Orleans Mayor announces state of emergency and calls for volunteer evacuation (no mandatory evacuation until 30 hours before expected landfall)
  • President Bush declares federal state of emergency in Louisiana upon request
  • 1701 Army National Guard and 932 Air National Guard deployed
Mayor of New Orleans declares 'mandatory evacuation for parish of Orleans'
Superdome opened as 'refuge of last resort' for residents unable to leave the city
Superdome opened as 'refuge of last resort' for residents unable to leave the city
Superdome opened as 'refuge of last resort' for residents unable to leave the city

• National Weather Service issues flash flood warning for Orleans Parish and St. Bernard Parish due to levee breach at Industrial Canal (3-8 feet of water were predicted)
  • 6–8ft of water in Lower Ninth Ward

• Approximately 10ft of water in St. Bernard Parish
  • New Orleans officials confirmed breach of 17th Street Canal levee
  • Two other confirmed levee breaches

• Press conference reveals officials are positive there have been casualties
  • Governor Blanco orders 68 school buses into New Orleans from surrounding parishes to begin evacuating any survivors remaining in the city
  • 6908 Army National Guard and 933 Air National Guard deployed

• Press conference reveals officials are positive there have been casualties
  • Governor Blanco orders 68 school buses into New Orleans from surrounding parishes to begin evacuating any survivors remaining in the city
  • 6908 Army National Guard and 933 Air National Guard deployed

• Press conference reveals officials are positive there have been casualties
  • Governor Blanco orders 68 school buses into New Orleans from surrounding parishes to begin evacuating any survivors remaining in the city
  • 6908 Army National Guard and 933 Air National Guard deployed

• Homeland Security Secretary, Michael Chertoff, becomes aware that the New Orleans levee breaches could not be plugged
  • Governor Blanco orders all of New Orleans, including the Superdome, be evacuated due to flooding
  • Reported looting, even by police officers, forces Governor Blanco to request backup from federal troops to restore law and order in New Orleans
  • 9668 Army National Guard and 956 Air National guard deployed
  • USCG helicopters rescue 350 people off roof tops

• Homeland Security Secretary, Michael Chertoff, becomes aware that the New Orleans levee breaches could not be plugged
  • Governor Blanco orders all of New Orleans, including the Superdome, be evacuated due to flooding
  • Reported looting, even by police officers, forces Governor Blanco to request backup from federal troops to restore law and order in New Orleans
  • 9668 Army National Guard and 956 Air National guard deployed
  • USCG helicopters rescue 350 people off roof tops

• Homeland Security Secretary, Michael Chertoff, becomes aware that the New Orleans levee breaches could not be plugged
  • Governor Blanco orders all of New Orleans, including the Superdome, be evacuated due to flooding
  • Reported looting, even by police officers, forces Governor Blanco to request backup from federal troops to restore law and order in New Orleans
  • 9668 Army National Guard and 956 Air National guard deployed
  • USCG helicopters rescue 350 people off roof tops

• Announced that the planned sandbagging of 17th Street Canal levee breach had failed
  • At this time 85% of New Orleans is under water
